00032 namespace UTAP
00033 {
00072     class SystemBuilder : public ExpressionBuilder
00073     {
00074     protected:
00075         // Error message for unsupported features
00076         static const char *const unsupported;
00077         static const char *const invalid_type;
00078 
00079         /* Flag used to determine how strict we check for inclusion 
00080            between ranges of integers. TODO: Replace this with a
00081            system, which reports a warning if there is a potential
00082            overflow. */
00083         bool strict_range;
00084 
00085         /* The current priority level, used when declaring process or
00086          * channel priorities.
00087          */
00088         int32_t currentPriority;
00089     private:
00090 
00091         //
00092         // The stack of type fragments. A type fragment is a pair
00093         // consiting of a type and an optional name (the name is 
00094         // used for fields of a structure).
00095         //
00096         class TypeFragments 
00097         {
00098         private:
00099             std::vector<std::pair<type_t, char *> > data;
00100         public:
00101             ~TypeFragments() 
00102                 { while (!data.empty()) pop(); }
00103             std::pair<type_t, char *> &operator[] (int idx)
00104                 { return data[data.size() - idx - 1]; }
00105             void push(type_t value)
00106                 { data.push_back(std::make_pair(value, (char*)NULL)); }
00107             void pop()
00108                 { assert(!data.empty()); free(data.back().second); data.pop_back(); }
00109         } typeFragments;
00110 
00111         // 
00112         // Support for handling template and function parameters
00113         //
00114 
00115         /* The params vector is used temporarily during parameter parsing */
00116         frame_t params;
00117 
00118         /* current parsing function structure */
00119         function_t *currentFun;
00120 
00121         template_t *currentTemplate;
00122 
00123         /* stack of function body statement blocks */
00124         std::vector<BlockStatement*> blocks; 
00125 
00126         /* stack of template symbols */
00127         std::vector<symbol_t> identifierStack;
00128 
00129         //
00130         // Fields for handling transition labels
00131         //
00132         int32_t guard;
00133         int32_t sync;
00134         int32_t update;
00135 
00136         //
00137         // Method for handling types
00138         //
00139 
00140         type_t buildArrayType(type_t type, uint32_t dim);
00141         type_t getElementTypeOfArray(type_t type);
00142         type_t applyPrefix(int32_t prefix, type_t type);
00143 
00144     protected:
00145 
00147         // property()
00149         // This method is called once for each property, which has
00150         // been parsed. The default implementation does nothing, so
00151         // you need to override this in a subclass.
00152         virtual void property(Constants::kind_t, int line, expression_t) {};
00153 
00154     public:
00155 
00156         SystemBuilder(TimedAutomataSystem *);
00157 
00158         /************************************************************
00159          * Types
00160          */
00161         virtual void typeName(int32_t prefix, const char* name, int range);
00162         // 2 expr if range==true
00163         virtual void typeStruct(int32_t prefix, uint32_t fields);
00164 
00165         virtual void structField(const char* name, uint32_t dim); 
00166         // 1 type and dim array sizes
00167         virtual void structFieldEnd();
00168 
00169         virtual void declTypeDef(const char* name, uint32_t dim); 
00170         // 1 type and dim array sizes
00171         virtual void declTypeDefEnd();
00172 
00173         /************************************************************
00174          * Variable declarations
00175          */
00176         virtual void declVar(const char* name, uint32_t dim, bool init); 
00177         // 1 type, dims, initializer if init==true
00178         virtual void declVarEnd();
00179         virtual void declInitialiserList(uint32_t num); // n initialisers
00180         virtual void declFieldInit(const char* name); // 1 initialiser
00181     
00182         /************************************************************
00183          * Function declarations
00184          */
00185         virtual void declParameter(const char* name, bool reference, uint32_t dim);
00186         // 1 type, dim array sizes
00187         virtual void declParameterEnd(); // pop parameter type
00188     
00189         virtual void declFuncBegin(const char* name, uint32_t n); // n paramaters
00190         virtual void declFuncEnd(); // 1 block
00191 
00192         /************************************************************
00193          * Process declarations
00194          */
00195         virtual void procBegin(const char* name, uint32_t n); // n parameters
00196         virtual void procEnd(); // 1 ProcBody
00197         virtual void procState(const char* name, bool hasInvariant); // 1 expr
00198         virtual void procStateCommit(const char* name); // mark previously decl. state
00199         virtual void procStateUrgent(const char* name); // mark previously decl. state
00200         virtual void procStateInit(const char* name); // mark previously decl. state
00201         virtual void procTransition(const char* from, const char* to); 
00202         // 1 epxr,1sync,1expr
00203         virtual void procGuard();
00204         virtual void procSync(Constants::synchronisation_t type); // 1 expr
00205         virtual void procUpdate();
00206     
00207         /************************************************************
00208          * Statements
00209          */
00210         virtual void blockBegin();
00211         virtual void blockEnd();
00212         virtual void emptyStatement();
00213         virtual void forBegin();
00214         virtual void forEnd(); // 3 expr, 1 stat
00215         virtual void whileBegin();
00216         virtual void whileEnd(); // 1 expr, 1 stat
00217         virtual void doWhileBegin();
00218         virtual void doWhileEnd(); // 1 stat, 1 expr
00219         virtual void ifBegin();
00220         virtual void ifElse();
00221         virtual void ifEnd(bool); // 1 expr, 1 or 2 statements
00222         virtual void breakStatement();
00223         virtual void continueStatement();
00224         virtual void switchBegin();
00225         virtual void switchEnd(); // 1 expr, 1+ case/default
00226         virtual void caseBegin();
00227         virtual void caseEnd();  // 1 expr, 0+ stat
00228         virtual void defaultBegin();
00229         virtual void defaultEnd(); // 0+ statements
00230         virtual void exprStatement(); // 1 expr
00231         virtual void returnStatement(bool); // 1 expr if argument is true
00232 
00233         /************************************************************
00234          * Expressions
00235          */     
00236         virtual void exprCallBegin(const char *);
00237     
00238         /************************************************************
00239          * System declaration
00240          */
00241         virtual void instantiationBegin(const char*, const char*);
00242         virtual void instantiationEnd(const char *, const char *, uint32_t n); // n arguments
00243         virtual void process(const char*);
00244 
00245         virtual void done();    
00246 
00247         virtual void property(Constants::kind_t, int line);
00248 
00249         /********************************************************************
00250          * Guiding
00251          */
00252 
00253         virtual void beforeUpdate();
00254         virtual void afterUpdate();
00255 
00256         /********************************************************************
00257          * Priority
00258          */
00259 
00260         virtual void lowPriority(const char*);
00261         virtual void samePriority(const char*);
00262         virtual void higherPriority(const char*);
00263     };
